comment: Easiest class of the semester. Since it was a beginner lab class he mostly focused on giving us advices. Dr. Ho is very nice to have a conversation with. Attendance matters so make sure to be there every lecture and try your best in assignments. You should be fine since assignment is worth only 60% rest 40% attendance.
The class is extremely straightforward, and Professor Ho is very clear with what needs to be done.

Dr. Ho's Machine learning class was an interesting class filled with assignments that helps understand the theory of Neural Networks. If you have never worked with Python, Dr. Ho will teach you how to use these but he will be a little tough when grading Python assignments as he wants you to excel in the language. The final project is fun!

One of the best professors I've had at KSU, he is a great lecturer and does good at describing hard-to-understand topics in very simple ways. Control Systems is hard, but Dr Ho frames it in a way that is easy to understand as a beginner. He also offers great insight into industry & career advice. Do whatever you can to take a class with Dr. Ho!

Dr. Ho goes fast through the math work. The lectures are available online, my advice is to just sit and watch him derive the equation, then take pictures of the board. It's easy to miss something he said because you're too busy trying to write it down. Only midterm and final, not to bad, just study. Gives the grade you deserve if he sees you try.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Respected--Graded by few things

comment: This is one of the best professors I've had. Take his classes! You will learn a lot and get a great knowledge of the topics. The only problem is that there are a lot of projects and assignments but these will be useful so that you don't have to study much for the exam. Also, start the semester project early.

Professor Ho was a great teacher. I had him for CPE1000 and the class was not that difficult. He made lectures interesting and does not give a lot of assignments. He will occasionally give pop quizzes in the first few minutes of class so make sure you go to class and get there on time.

Dr. Ho is a great professor and really wants the students to succeed. He does his best to break down the complex topics in a way that is easy to understand and will be relevant in the Industry. Would recommend him for any course.

Dr. Ho wants you to move forward in education. His lectures are great and he really knows how to get the class engaged. We worked on RPis (get ready to spend the money to purchase the parts), which were easy assignments. Very caring professor and likes to check in with you during class about your semester.

You get your monies worth with this guy. Multitude of industry experience, vast leadership experience with VP & executive type roles. He is leaps and bounds ahead of the average professor who has a doctorate degree with no real or limited experience professionally. Take him at all costs.

He is a good professor and really cares about your success, his class is lecture heavy but he makes it inspirational and interesting. I only wish that some of his assignments we did in class instead of on our own.

Great instructor. Lectures include your normal material, but also include information to just help you as a person. There is a lot of thought and care that went into his lectures. It was the best course I have ever taken at KSU solely due to the instructor, Dr. Hai Ho. He is very inspiring; I aspire to be like him. Plus the material was just cool!

Dr. Ho streamlined what could have been a tedious Senior Design course. You absolutely must work for every point, but he supplements your work with casual lectures on his industry time and the new product development process. He grades based on your report submissions, which should build into the final project report. Absolutely worth taking.

Dr. Ho is a solid professor. His tests can be challenging, but he knows his controls material inside and out. He'll punctuate part of his lectures with some of his stories working for various companies as a controls and product engineer. Definitely not a boring class and worth your time if you have the opportunity to take Dr. Ho.
Good professor for control systems engineering.
